timeline.message:
JMS connector SE api

Signed-off-by: Daniel Kec <daniel.kec@oracle.com>

Doc for JMS connector in SE flavor

Signed-off-by: Daniel Kec <daniel.kec@oracle.com>

timeline.bodyText:
This class should use a builder. If we need a separate constructor for CDI, so be it, but there should be a constructor with a builder, that allows explicit configuration of everything that can be configured through config.
In SE, there is always a choice for developer - either build everything by hand, or use a config, or a combination
For example the executor services must be configurable, as user may want to reuse an executor service for multiple components
timeline.author: tomas-langer

timeline.message:
SE JmsConnector builder

Signed-off-by: Daniel Kec <daniel.kec@oracle.com>

timeline.bodyText: The Builder should be a static inner class of JmsConnector, not a standalone class - is there a reason for breaking this rule?
timeline.author: tomas-langer

timeline.bodyText: Please also add methods for Supplier<ExecutorService> (and Supplier<ScheduledExecutorServer> below) so we can pass our ThreadPoolSupplier directly.
timeline.author: tomas-langer

timeline.message:
Move JMSConnector builder to inner class

Signed-off-by: Daniel Kec <daniel.kec@oracle.com>

AQ SE api

Signed-off-by: Daniel Kec <daniel.kec@oracle.com>

AQ SE tests

Signed-off-by: Daniel Kec <daniel.kec@oracle.com>

Jms example fix

Signed-off-by: Daniel Kec <daniel.kec@oracle.com>

Jakarta JTA instead of Javax

Signed-off-by: Daniel Kec <daniel.kec@oracle.com>

timeline.bodyText: This should be require static as well
timeline.author: tomas-langer

timeline.bodyText: Using Config.create() may not be correct - do you really want to add environment variables, system properties and the default configuration source (such as application.yaml) to this configuration instance?
timeline.author: tomas-langer

replies.bodyText: That was the idea, connector without any configuration is useless
replies.author: danielkec

replies.bodyText: We have agreed to use empty config, as that is the expectation by user. Config.create() may pick up unexpected configuration files.
replies.author: tomas-langer

timeline.author: tomas-langer
